reviews.text: Stopped by for dinner with a group en route to a volleyball game at Marymount. Loved this place! Wish I wasn't driving and could have enjoyed one of the many, many beers on tap or in the coolers to go. Friendly, welcoming vibe. We all had pizza and it didn't disappoint. The dog artwork is hilarious and their mission admirable. Worth a stop!

I am thoroughly impressed with this pizza shop. They carry St. Bernardus! And extensive array of other famous beers from around the world. I’ve found a gem. They actually have St. B Apt 12 on draft (at least today). Never seen that before (and it’s just $9–that’s like at cost almost).
A restaurant with great personality! Nice staff, a large menu and plenty of good things to try. I tried The Cowbow... amazing! Kids menu portions may be small, but it is a detail.

Great place, their pizza is by far one of the best pizzas that I have tried. Great environment and a great selection of alcoholic drinks. Also, a great selection of canned beer. Will definitely try to comeback before heading back west.

Great service, extensive sandwich and pizza options, and solid draft list. Reasonably priced with good portions. Gluten free pizza crust was chewy and not crumbly! Will definitely want to return if/when we’re back on that side of town.

Can easily be less than $15/person without drinks or appetizers.

Met some friends at this shack which I never knew existed and had a great time.  Band was playing some nice music, for a great table and the food and beer was excellent. There were a lot of people around 5:30 pm that kept the wait staff quite busy so service wasn’t to the level I’m used to but the waiter kept everything flowing.  Took a long time to get the food so expect that if they are busy.  Overall a fun atmosphere and beach Bine and I would definitely recommend as it.

There's not much to say other than this place is great in every way.  Great food, good vibe and great service.  We got the hush puppies and fried pickles to start and both were excellent.  Had the fish and chips and sand thing, really good and fresh.  Can't wait to go back!

I was really excited about this place because of the rave food and drink reviews, but it was overall disappointing to say the least. We ordered two margaritas and grilled fish tacos, and none were good. Ordered the margs without ice, but they still tasted watered down and not sweet- hard to explain the taste but they were just bad. The fish tacos were also not good- lacking any flavor, period. I'm not sure any of it was salted, and was expecting some lime or a citrus flavor that wasn't there. The slaw was wilted and old, and none of it was fresh or even warm. The rice isn't even normal rice that comes with fish tacos, it's like sprouted wheat you'd find in a health food store. Very disappointed because I was looking forward to checking this place out. I would say the portions are large, but I'll probably end up throwing all of this away. The only saving grace are the sides of guac, sour cream, and salsa that may help.

I posted the above message on Yelp(thinking it would help improve the quality of the food), and the owner’s response was rude and unprofessional. The temperature was not even the main problem (the food wasn't even warm, it was cold and I live right down the road)- the food should taste good regardless of temperature, which neither the food nor drinks did. Also, the food should taste the same whether it's sit down or to go, basically restaurant rule of thumb lol. I wouldn't recommend this establishment if it was the last place on earth. The business owner likes to reply “lol” when given any slight criticism so I shouldn’t be surprised at their snarky response. Maybe improve your business and you’ll get better reviews.

Interesting beach-themed restaurant with very nice and interesting decor. The food was okay (had the alligator tail), but was a bit pricey for what it was. The beer selection was okay, too, but could be better. Fairly decent place overall.

Always fun to go to Clare & Don's Beach Shack and a bonus to be able to bring the dogs!  Their expanded space is great so less wait time, but parking is not as convenient with the expansion. They have made arrangements for plenty of overflow parking within a few minutes walk so not a big deal. Service is attentive and the food is good. The size of the side dipping sauces is too small but they gladly bring additional when asked. So fun and casual. Conversation with other diners flows easily and people are generally good about seeing good friendly dogs. The wait staff brings clean water bowls without asking. Fun times!

I love this place. They have the best Huevos Rancheros for brunch that I've had. The food is delicious and it comes out unbelievably fast. They have multiple outdoor areas to sit in. Probably more seating outside than in. There's a nice long bar inside with lots of beers on tap. Say hi to their great bartender Amber. She's a riot.

I was surprised by this place. Really enjoyed the flavors. I tried the vegetarian wrap with cauliflower and it was delicious.
The vibe is nice, even the outdoor was well maintained and great for having an sport bar experience.
Next time I must try the loaded nachos and the wings.

I visited on a Monday evening on my way back home after remembering how I enjoyed their sister restaurant Bear Branch Tavern. Parking can be challenging in this area, so walking a block or so can be expected. The inside struck me as quite dark even for a tavern (one person next to me had to use his phone light to read the menu). The barkeep greeted me promptly and was largely attentive. Food arrived at mostly appropriate times.

I started with grilled wings followed by the blackened mahi-mahi sandwich followed by a burger with fries and ending with key lime pie. The wings had good flavor and well cooked meat, but the amount of char seemed somewhat excessive especially towards the last couple. The mahi sandwich had an indescribable taste that felt neither good nor bad to me. Both the cole slaw and side salad were fresh tasting. My request for a burger medium rare without a bun had the correct temperature but seemed a little salty to me. The fries tasted inconsistent, as some of my waffle fries felt warm and appealing and others were more room temperature and even stale. I liked the key lime pie itself with a balanced tart flavor and a crust that broke easy with my spoon. As minor points, the diced mango garnish seemed unripe and the mango coulis could have been more generous compared to what shows on the menu.

The total bill amounted to a little under $65 excluding tax and tip. I think other menu items could lure me back for another visit and maybe experience more consistency in the cooking.
Loved the old style sports bar and a restaurant. Food was delicious and service was extraordinary. The lady served the food was very knowledgeable and doing above and beyond with our requests.

Very comfortable, well-decorated sports bar/neighborhood restaurant. Plenty of seating.  Public parking around the back. Obligatory big screens dot the walls along with framed pictures. The place on a Wed night was full. Their menu was appealing, with a wide selection of unique salads and entrées.  Both of our choices were excellent!  (Now we understand Dogwood's popularity.)  My wife loved the Buddha Bowl.  Just as rotund as Buddha himself, this salad was heaping full of a favorable mixture of spinach, quinoa, roasted beets, basil pesto, avocado, a hard-boiled egg, w olives & garbanzo beans tossed in house balsamic vinegarette. It was quite a meal. My French Onion Burger was delectable!  So nice to eat a burger without the usual ketchup/mustard pickle condiments! The 1/2 lb burger w swiss was cooked perfectly medium then placed between a softened potato bun smeared w French onion spread and ladened w caramelized onions. Add a warm au jus for dipping and a fresh salad w chunky blue cheese and this plate was killing!  Glad we chose the Dogwood Tavern.

- food was good, the Ruben was extremely flavorful that my girl had. The chick tullamore I got was good for the most part but the chicken was a bit dry.

- the bread they give you was a bit weird and kinda hard I know it's how it's supposed to be but still not that great to my taste.

- have a nice selection of items on the menu.

- inside is nice and quiet when we went, the outside is super nice and comfortable looking. Definitely would recommend outside seating when the weather is nice.

- staff were a mix, some really friendly and others didn't have much of a personality.

- service was a bit off it seemed like when we went but still not the worst we've experienced.

- places was clean and organized.

- prices normal for the area.

- parking is good as long as they are not over the top busy.

- overall not a bad first experience at this location.

Great place to visit to get your Irish fix!  Great service!  We had breakfast there on St. Patrick’s Day, and people were drinking beer already☘️
We enjoyed the ambience and food. Totally recommend! (Constructive criticism:  cook your “baked beans”.  They tasted like they were dumped out of a can, and just warmed-up.  You have to simmer them; evaporate some liquid, and concentrate the flavor. And the toast; there was no crisp, no crunch. Just my opinion.)

This place is huge
The hamburgers were so good. We all ordered them and everyone enjoyed them. They were well seasoned. For those of us that got bacon, we each had at least three full slices.
The steak fries were crispy.
The brie appetizer was good, but I preferred eating it on the softer bread.

I visited on a quiet Wednesday evening waiting out some rain with some comfort food. The interior looked clean and inviting. Service was pleasant and friendly throughout. I ordered potato and leek soup and sausage rolls for appetizers, fish and chips, and bread pudding. Dishes arrived at appropriate times throughout my meal.

The complimentary brown bread came in two flavors, both striking me as somewhat dry (even for soda bread). The soup was smooth with a subtle potato flavor. I prefer this kind of soup to have more texture from diced potato and sautéed leek myself, but this version was pleasing to eat nonetheless. My server recommended the mustards accompanying the sausage rolls, and she was correct in saying how the rolls taste great with either Irish yellow mustard or stone grain and stout mustard. The pastry was flaky and just a tad chewy, and the sausage had a proper European flavor and texture. Overall a good appetizer portion. The fish had a great crunch, satisfying thermal heat, and flaky texture. I sensed a slight oiliness with the outside, but I gladly finished my plate. Fries were warm and good crispiness without being oily at all. More cole slaw would have been welcome, as their version was not overdressed at all. Even the tartar sauce had some diced pickle to add some welcome acidity along with the lemon garnish. The bread pudding was soft. The amount of sauce seemed excessive to me given the portion of pudding, but I could see how others might enjoy.

The total for my meal fell between $40-$50 without tax or tip. I am glad I visited and would consider returning to sample a beef dish such as the shepherd’s pie or the stew.

We stopped in this place to check it out because we love Irish pubs. We're out of towners, and the bartenders were super nice and chatted us up. The first night it was late, after the kitchen was already to be closed but the bartender (I think his name was Shawn) managed to get us a Shepherds pie. It was big enough for two of us to share and it was pretty good. The second night we stopped in, not so hungry, and tried the croquettes. There are three that we split and it was plenty for the two of us, but again, we weren't too hungry. If you like Irish pubs its definitely worth stopping in for a bite and a pint.

It's one of my favorite Lebanese restaurants.

My friends don't like it much and believe that it's overpriced.

Love the bread and zaatar

Love the lentil Soup

I love the taboule

They have a lot of good options, I love almost everything they have except for the grilled things (mix grill.. shishtawook.. kofta.. etc. ) those are dry and not the best.

Parking available
I really enjoyed this place. I had the mixed platter. It was very good. Service was great. Decor was nice. I think this is the original location. I would definitely recommend this place.
First time eating shawarma and lamb kebabs. Food was prepared nicely and tasted amazing. I will be back for more !
Wonderful experience tonight with my wife and brother-in-law. Sanisha was an excellent server and made the meal perfect. Her wine suggestions and food recommendations were on point. Great spot!
Service was great and the food was even better. Really well priced and every dish I had was really flavorful. Definitely my new favorite restaurant!

A cozy place to have a romantic French meal! The food was delicious the service was good. We waited forever for our starter, but once we let the waiter know he quickly had it on our table. We did th3 course valentines day weekend meal. The lamb was delicious but I think the Brie stater was my favorite.  Will definitely come back again.

Went here for Arlington restaurant week and we absolutely enjoyed it! Warm and cozy vibe, with a super affordable and filling pre-fixe meal.

Will definitely be going back to try their brunch menu.

Parking can be a bit tough since it’s in the street so budget in some extra time if you have a reservation.

Great food.
The lamb chops are so good and delicious, make you think that you are eating butter.
The fries and mushrooms with garlic so yummy.
The apple pie is probably the best in nova.
The people that work there are so nice and friendly.
The place needs some renovation specially the chairs are not comfortable at all.

Went to La Côte D'Or Café on a random Sunday for dinner and was pleasantly surprised. The atmosphere and staff were very warm and charming. The food was delicious and exactly what you would expect from a traditional French restaurant. We had the house smoked salmon salad and Escargots for an appetizer, and the Grouper du Pêcheur and Roasted rack of lamb for our entrees. Everything was spot on. For dessert we had the Floating Island- yum :) If you haven't been here, I highly recommend stopping by!

Beautiful little restaurant. Visited during Winter restaurant week. Everything was good and prepared well.

The scallops and escargot were my favorite, perfect texture and flavor was on point 🤌
My boyfriend had the lamb with beans and he enjoyed it very much, perfectly cooked and didn't taste gamey.

The baked brie, shrimps and deviled eggs were good, but nothing to rave about.

The desserts, bread pudding and baked red wine pear were delicious. Incredibly light and not very sweet, but that hit the spot after such a heavy meal.

Note: As of December 2022, you need to order by phone and they'll bring your food out to a table that's blocking the door.

Service was quick, order was accurate, and food was tasty. They also put enough toppings in my takeout bag for all my sandwiches (some places skimp). The price also includes tax, so it's easy to do the math and you're less likely to get ripped off (unlike other places that shall remain nameless...)

Spherical loaf that has a thick crunchy cross section beyond the first few millimeters: bread crumbs will coat the table and your clothes.  Bread is the star. Meats are in the backseat. This might be a good course correction if always eat classic combination sandwich

It’s not good like before but until now, it’s still the best compare with Banh mi so 1 , banh mi Huong Binh, Phươc Lộc hay DC sandwich
The owner wants to give up because the rent is too hight 5000 / month for this location is really expensive
I heard a lot form tenant at Eden Center
Feel sorry for them

A very nice place to get a banh mi sandwich. The sandwiches are very good here, probably some of the best, but there are no Vietnamese iced-coffees on the menu. I like to have a Vietnamese iced-coffee with my banh mi!
fresh toppings, still quality while other banh mi places have not kept up

What an awesome place to have nearby. I’m a big fan of traditional Japanese sushi - not the fried, mayo and sugar sauce coated creations so common now. If you also share a love for simple, clean sushi made with very high quality ingredients by a chef who respects tradition, go here! On top of it all they are super friendly and nice. Chef Tao came out and played with my daughter at one point which was great.

Update: after 6 months living in the area now, I’ve probably been here 15 times. It’s always good. It’s not the fanciest place, but it just feels comfy and welcoming, and the food is just awesome especially for the price. If you want great authentic Japanese food without all the fuss, come here!

A cute Japanese restaurant in the heart of falls church city! I loved the cozy atmosphere and the staff was so friendly. I ordered something a little bit off-menu (katsu curry) but they were happy to oblige and it was so good! They were super generous with the ingredients- a lot more chicken than I expected in the curry, but everything was cooked down so well and the carrots were nice and soft. They had some specials up on the walls that I'm looking forward to trying next time!

My family and I have been coming here for a long time.  We think it's one of the best Japanese restaurants in the area, but this was our first time back since COVID started.  I'm only marking it 4/5 instead of 5/5 since I thought that the Miso soup was a bit watery.  They must be going for a more subtle taste but personally I prefer a more robust flavor.  Everything else was exceptional though.  The Futomaki had a balanced combination of ingredients and flavors.  Sushi rice can be hard to perfect, but the rice in these rolls was sweet and sticky without either quality being overpowering.  The egg was nicely spongy while still having a slight firmness.  The other sushi rolls I tried were excellent as well, and the oily, chewy fish eggs that coated one of them were a particular highlight.  My main course was a Teriyaki New York strip steak served with a side of rice and salad.  The steak was marinated in a thick layer of teriyaki and dotted with sesame seeds, and the meat itself wrapped my taste buds in a warm embrace of juicy tenderness.  If you're in the area and want to treat yourself to some delectable Japanese food, look no further than Maneki Neko.

Modest space with nice outdoor seating in front and attentive service, plus parking in the rear. The sushi, while good, wasn’t particularly great and some pieces tasted more fresh than others. Very good prices though, especially for the $11 lunch bento box deal.

Cute place. We entered through the back entrance where there is some parking. We got nigiri, the Sashimi deluxe, and a couple rolls.

They had some HH prices for the Nigiri. Mackarel was $1.75/piece. Tamago was $3.50/piece. Flying Fish Roe and Octopus was both $5.50/piece. We also got some Eel and Squid. For our rolls, we got the Tuna Avocado Roll and the Surf and Turf. The Surf and Turf isn't exactly what I was expecting but overall the food was pretty good.

Great service and the staff is really friendly!

Go here for a good, home-cooked meal vibe. The pho broth is delicate and perfectly clear. The veggie summer rolls are simple and delicious. Their lemongrass chicken and rice was good. The vermicelli dishes don’t come with all the bells and whistles (toppings) like in fancier restaurants yet here everything is cooked with soul and love. This is our new favorite go to for lunch, the portions are just right and the price is reasonable.

Food = Good flavor and like a good home cooked meal (Not over oily or salty. 👍) Portion size was good and we had no leftovers.
Service = Friendly and attentive

We came with a party of 8, including 4 kids. They were friendly and attentive to us including all 4 children under six years old with extra plates and cups, etc. The food had good flavors and they were appropriate portions.

We’ve been back and definitely good flavors

I’ve eaten here multiple times since first moving into the area in early 2020. It’s now 2022 and I can say that the quality is consistently good.

I finally remembered to take a picture of my order and decided to write this review. This time I ordered their Lemongrass Chicken vermicelli dish and it was so fresh! I’m not a fan of fish sauce so I hadn’t add any while eating so it was a bit dry, would have gone great with some peanut sauce but nonetheless still tasty and fresh. The hoisin sauce by the table did help moisten the dish.

Will still be giving this place a five star since this is my first complaint among many many orders and I still loved it. Will be going back :)

Got #6 & #11 pho!
It was good but not GREAT! The pho had like 4 small pieces of meat. If you’re starving the regular will not be sufficient.
They charge you 0.25cents for more than the 2 limes they give you.
I really like that this place is open till 9:30pm on Sunday’s. Latest one around here. Service was great! Server seemed very nice.

Excellent, friendly service and staff. Quick delivery of food.

The portions for everything but Pho are small for the price, beware (the fried chicken entree was appetizer-sized, and was simply fried chicken breast on top of white rice). The pho, however, is giant. Two of us got the smaller bowls, and could not finish. A large bowl will easily feed two. At $11 and $12, respectively, it is an amazing value ($6/person for dinner is a steal). Their boba tea is excellent. The quality and variety (tripe!) of meats were also excellent. The sprouts and basil were day-of fresh, clearly they take daily delivery of produce. Freshness all around was excellent. First time visiting, this will become a regular haunt. And they're never busy, so you are guaranteed a table whenever you go (unfortunately).

name: Huong Viet Restaurant
vicinity: Sidewalk Stores, 6785 Wilson Boulevard, Falls Church

reviews.text:
Our favorite Vietnamese restaurant .
If you are looking for classy date vibes this is not the place but if you are looking for awesome, hearty, home cooking only a Vietnamese  mom can make,  then this place be it!
Service is fast-paced and tables are rarely empty on a weekend but it is sooo worth the wait.
Spring rolls are freshly fried and crispy, pho soups are hot and flavorful and lemongrass grilled beef is delicious.
I’m salivating just thinking about it 😋
Oh and bring CASH !

i love love love this place! the food is so incredibly delicious and the service is very quick and professional. i’ve ordered many things from the menu including, caramelized pork, lemongrass chicken, chicken stir fry, spring rolls, and shredded pork rolls, but i always come back to their bun thit. i love both the pork and chicken options. this place is definitely a must try for anyone who loves vietnamese food. be warned, they take cash only!

My friend took me to Eden Center and it was quite a treat, and our rich tour centered around a delicious meal here.

We started with the fried rolls, they were perfectly crisp, with a succulent filing, and went well with fish sauce-based dipping sauce.

We enjoyed a trip of mains:

A rice wrap dish called Banh Hoi Nem Nuong where you dip the rice wrap briefly in warm water and then fill with a soft, woven shredded noodle and meat and again ideally dip in either the peanut sauce or the fish sauce. Really solid sausage in the one we tried.

A fried noodle dish named Mi Xao Gion where the noodles are dried and fried crisp, presenting like raw ramen noodles and topped with a thick curry sauce and lots of veggies, meat, and seafood. Very tasty as well.

Last and best was the epic fried crepe dish called Banh Xeo filled with sprouts and seafood. The flavor of the crepe alone was enough, and the filling was a welcome accent.

Service was blazingly fast, they may have been laser printing the food in the back, I'm not sure.

It's a no frills place, cash only close at 8pm during the week. And while they will provide anything you need (an additional utensil, sauce, etc), they're not holding your hand and checking on you every second.

Looking forward to returning and enjoying more items in the future.

The restaurant is nice and clean, with unique decorated ceiling. Service was fast. The bun bo hue was really good, well balanced flavors and spices. It paired well with lemon and fresh veggies. I also like their ca phe sua da (Vietnamese iced coffee with condensed milk), rich and delicious. I wish I could live closer, I’d go here every weekend. The only inconvenience is that they don’t accept credit cards.
The food is $20 per plate but it’s a HUGE portion. They have Bun Dau Mam Tom for $25, but it needs more veggies on it. The crispy noodles need more veggies. The soft noodles combo is pretty good.
Food hit the spot! We ordered cheesesteaks and the kids chicken + fries. Previously had pizza which was pretty good too. Carryout food was still hot when we got home. Will return.

Went in to get a salad( they have the best ones) and had trouble using my rewards. The manager Ricky was extremely helpful to be sure I would be able to use it. Bonus!!! They had stopped carrying their amazing house dressing and had switched to Kens dressing, but when I got home and opened my bag it had the original Paisanos hose dressing!!!! So happy!!! Thanks for the great customer service and as always the great food 😁

Ordered 2 pizzas and asked they by cooked well done. They were busy when I picked them up so instead of checking the pizzas I just asked the lady if they were well done. She said yes. When I got home I found both pizzas were not well done, but actually under cooked. They were simply a gooey mess! Most of the toppings were concentrated in the middle. Since I couldn't eat the raw middle I don't know if they were good. I gave them 2 stars because the crust was decent. This was my first (and last) pizza from Paisano's.

Update: 24 Feb 23
The owner requested me to send my contact information to the store manager. I sent my contact information as requested. The manager HAS NOT contacted me. Sadly I'm not surprised. I dropped my rating from 2 to 1 star for that reason.

I placed a large catering order for the office. Ricky was fantastic - very patient as I made specific requests and he made a great suggested meal for a vegan employee. Delivery was on time and the food was fresh and delicious.  Received so many compliments on my choice of catering so THANK YOU to Ricky and his team!!

I ordered from here due to the recommendation of others. I called and placed my order for a small cheese pizza and cheese bread. I came to pick up my order and waited ten minutes at the counter before anyone even walked over. I got home and the pizza itself was cold. The cheese bread I ordered was incorrect. I was given bacon cheese fries and I don’t even eat that. All in all, I don’t recommend it and will not be returning.

This restaurant has authentic Vietnamese food and is relatively clean. Our server, Huong, was very helpful and accommodating to our requests. The Bún bò Huế and Bún mắm were truly magnificent. I was particularly impressed by how well the soup and noodles complement each other. The pig trotter in the Bún bò Huế was tender, succulent and full of flavors, so we ordered extra. Please be aware they do not accept American Express, and we are truly grateful they made a one-off exception for us.

This restaurant has authentic Vietnamese food and although located next to the pool hall is the Vietnam experience I was looking for. Our server,Thu Nguyen, was very helpful in accommodating to our requests. The cahn nam soup and Bún mắm were okay, I'm not into this type of soup.

I was particularly impressed by how well the soup and noodles complement each other. The pig trotter in the Bún bò Huế was tender, succulent and full of flavors, so we ordered extra.
LOVELY LITTLE AUTHENTIC VIETNAMESE SPOT, TUCKED INSIDE THIS PLAZA! SERVICE IS FAST, FRIENDLY AND FOOD IS DELICIOUS!

This is a great place to check out if you're in the mood for Vietnamese food aside from the usual pho. The fish head noodle soup, bun mam, is pretty good. The banh cuon said gon is really delicious. The fried fish cakes are a little over fried and might be reheated too much.
They are specialized in serving Banh Cuon and Bun Rieu. Nice and cozy place. The subtle smell of fish sauce may not be very comfortable for some people.

The fresh spring rolls with shrimp from here are great!!! The cilantro is a wonderful flavor addition.  A couple of weeks ago, I ate chicken fresh spring rolls with chicken from a *different* Thai place and they were nothing compared to these (only had lettuce, chicken and carrots). The only thing I would add to the spring rolls with shrimp is more shrimp!!!

The curry puffs are good but fried a little too long for my liking. My husband's spicy chicken fried rice with shrimp was great but again, need more shrimp (there were only 3, so you may want to ask for extra if you order this add-on). His food container was filled to the top like it should be (and is what we're used to receiving), but mine wasn't, so I was a little disappointed about that.

Last but not least, my garlic chicken was good, but didn't have as much garlic flavor as what I'm used to from similar restaurants. The vegetables were definitely fresh tasting and not overcooked, so I was pleased.

The restaurant is in a small shopping strip; not a lot of parking out front but perhaps there's more parking in the back. Also, they have a nice patio area for those who want to eat outside.

Their green curry is really yummy! I didn’t love anything else though. Pad See Ew wasn’t that great, and the eggplant tempura had zero flavor.  That being said the service was good and so was the curry

I had a wonderful experience dining at Thai Noy tonight.  I have had take out from here many times and have never been disappointed.  After pandemic and with the current inflation, the prices here are very reasonable, the service was on point, and the food was amazing.  I will continue to support this business for as long as I live in the area.  5 stars no question.
Hometown hole in the wall. Great people, great food. Not a single noodle unsauced in the pad see-ew, the crispiest tilapia and a sauce you'll want to douse everything in.

Delicious food at a family business!! We got the shrimp dumplings, the green curry (chicken) and the vegetarian curry (red curry) and the curries were AMAZING. Great portions for the price. The Sing Ha thai beer was also lovely. Looking forward to returning here.

Update:
I contacted their customer service. It was a bit delayed, but they were able to assist with the problem. I still enjoy their acai bowls, but we make sure to double check our orders from now on.

November 2022: Extremely disappointed and frustrated.
My partner ordered me a bowl and what I received was not only the wrong size, but they completely messed up the order.

What was ordered was a Pure Love bowl with no pineapple. Extra strawberries + Chia, along with everything else standard.

What I got was this tiny bowl topped with tons of coconut & no granola.

I contacted their customer service but I haven't received a response after 40 minutes.

I was genuinely looking forward to breaking my fast with this acai bowl. And I'm feeling extra emotional due to my period. But it ruined my day.

Old review: Amazing! South Block is THE BEST place to get an açai bowl in the dmv.

Reviewing as a coffee shop. It's probably awesome as a juice bar. So we stopped in on our way back to Fairfax after picking up a geocache in a nearby Falls Church location. We put nearby coffee houses in Google maps and picked the one that wasn't a SB and said it had the best coffee in East Falls Church. I got mine black and LMP54 had some half-and-half with hers.  Mine had a bit of a bitter after taste. LMP54 liked hers. This definitely has more of a juice bar feel than a coffee house feel and, looking it up after the fact, it is a juice bar! IT'S PROBABLY AWESOME AS A JUICE BAR as it had a fresh fruit tasty juicy smell. Parking could be tight but we were able to slip into a 15-min spot across the street so that worked out perfectly. The photos of the carved tree were close to the geocache that brought us to Falls Church to begin with.
Not bad - I ordered an acai bowl and two smoothies, it took way too long to be made even though it wasn’t that busy, so that’s why I took 1 star off.

My favorite smoothie place in the Arlington area. The AB&J smoothie and the Super greens smoothie are the best-- they are too sweet for me but it's easy for me to substitute plant milk instead of juice plus add ginger and spirulina, and they always offer free chia seeds! I wish there was one near College Park, MD-- I would go there all the time!
Meh. Affordable overall but poor quality food. Not many breakfast options besides açaí bowls and smoothies. Could help to have eggs as part of the menu.

What a find, amazing food!  The quality of the items we ordered was superb. We had a variety of items and all were delicious. The outdoor seating was perfect. Dora was a fantastic server and she  took excellent care of us.  Not cheap but worth every penny. We will be back!

Delicious!! My husband and I went there today because we were craving Mediterranean food and I’ve been meaning to check out Yayla. The place did not disappoint! We got the trio spread with ezme, htipiti, and smoky eggplant & yogurt. They were all tasty. We also got the shepherd salad which was very refreshing. We were craving meat today so decided to share the mixed grill platter—wow, was that amazing! The lamb chops and filet mignon were amazing quality and cooked perfectly. The adana kebab was really flavorful and I loved that it has a spicy kick! The chicken was definitely less exciting than the other meats but it was also cooked well. Loved the potatoes too. Thoroughly enjoyed our meal and service was spectacular too. Glad to have found this spot—we’ll definitely be back!

We were in Arlington to visit friends for the weekend and had lunch here. The food is delicious and the service is superb. I ordered the Manti and it was delicious. I ended the meal with the baklava and a Turkish coffee.

I loved the atmosphere and the friendly staff, and all the food we got was good for the most part. I recommend the mezze dips and spreads.
The reason for knocking off a star is the high prices, as well as for my spinach pie. It tasted good, however, it was not hot in the middle and the phyllo crust was soggy. It was apparent that they made a batch and it was sitting out for a while.
Plenty of options for vegetarians. I would come back here for a special occasion.
Best Turkish and Kurdish food in the region. Great services and very nice owner, checking on tables ad ensuring all is well. Love it and will return.
Very good "ốc" dishes. Very flavorfull. And the service is very friendly.
Little shop with excellent pho and friendly people.

Com Tam Saigon has been at Eden Center for many years, pretty much since the opening of Saigon West wing. They seem to do brisk business with carryout and catering orders. We ventured here for a late lunch in January. It's a small space with a lot of the work overflow spilling onto some of the tables. A man was wrapping banh chung for Tet, but we were able to sit at a small table by the window.

It helps to speak Vietnamese, but you can get by with pointing out what you want. The restaurant has a small dry erase board with their specialties. Since "rice" is in their name, you can't go wrong with ordering "Com Tam Saigon", which is listed as #1. The dish includes broken jasmine rice (com tam), shredded pork (bi), grilled marinated pork chop (thit nuong), steamed pork quiche (cha), a fried egg, and Chinese sausage (lap suong). The dish is a generous size and comes with a small bowl of broth with cilantro to enjoy after your meal. It was truly delicious and the pork was tender and had a bit of char. Use the fish sauce (nuoc mam) and mix it into your rice and bi. There are condiments to doctor the fish sauce to your preferred level of heat.

CASH ONLY! The com tam is $9/each including tax. Most places in Eden Center charge $8.50-99. Considering the egg is usually a $1 surcharge at other places, it ends up being the same amount you would spend anyway with tax.
Want traditional Vietnamese broken rice this is the place to go. We don't visit Eden Center often but when we do we stop by here and take home our dinner. ( we live about 90 miles away)
Good food, friendly and good service

name: Starbucks
vicinity: Broaddale Village Shopping Center, 344 West Broad Street, Falls Church

reviews.text:
Staff were busy but working fast to get orders completed.
Only store to have mocha cookie crumble for a while.
Good sized area inside as well and seating available outside too.

Quite a spacious Starbucks and runs deep in with good amount of seating. Very clean and well decorated with 2 clean restrooms. The best part is the service. Everyone is way too friendly, not used to this coming from NYC. Very refreshing and enjoyable. There is a person at the mobile order area greeting you, thought that was a nice touch. Actually frequent Starbucks very often around the country and this is probably one of my favorites.

Lady at the register was not friendly at all. Her name is Terra. When I ordered a coffee she didn’t even ask me if I want extra room for creamer. Then I had to come back and when asked to pour some of the coffee to the sink to have extra room for coffee she simply said “Trash can is over there!” and immediately walked away with angry face. Worst experience at Starbucks at this location!
First thing you would notice after few visits to this location is the awesome staff they have. And the relaxed atmosphere makes you feel good irrespective of how busy it is.

I came to this store earlier, and I'm amazed at how unfriendly and rude the barista with the ginger hair is. I believe her name began with a T. I'm shocked that someone like her can treat customers and even coworkers in that way. I worked at Starbucks for a couple of years in college. Unquestionably does not reflect the principles of Starbucks, and I won't be returning to this location!

I am no stranger to spicy food. I've had enough exposure to hot dishes that you might say I've been, pun fully intended, seasoned. So it was with confidence that I marched into the Hot N' Juicy location at Falls Church and boldly ordered both the fried shrimp and friend catfish basket with Cajun seasoning. My waiter told me that it would be a mild kick, and I figured that it would be nothing too out of the ordinary for me.

I was wrong.

The Cajun seasoning was hot enough to force tears and sniffles throughout nearly all of my meal. The catfish was tolerable and quite tasty, but the shrimp, because of what was no doubt excessive batter, was almost too hot to eat which of course diminished my enjoyment of the dish.

Still, I overall liked what I ate and would return again (although I'd obviously choose a much less intense spice). My waiter was helpful but not as attentive as I would like. This one gets a solid 4 from me.

Great food, I ordered the Hot N Tender basket and it was made very well! My sister loves this place and gets “get your feet wet” she enjoyed it as well! But the service was inattentive and our server didn’t come to us often. We had to speak to other servers when we needed. But overall I recommend!

Ordered takeout, and by the time I got home the shrimps were mushy. Otherwise great food and great service. The Cajun calamari in particular were really good. Wasn't expecting much from it but it might be my favorite at hot n juicy now.  Slightly overpriced but will definitely be returning for more.

My only complaint is the corn had gotten really bad along with the Fluctuation in price. Our server recommended some great chicken strips. Great Service and very very clean. The taste is always amazing. I was able to go home and reheat the next day. Added fresh corn & eggs

We have been to Hot N Juicy multiple times, everyone who has helped us with our food and drink orders has been amazing. Like all things in life, you get what you give. It feels so good to give and get at HNJ! Always an enjoyable meal and conversations happening.

THIS PLACE DOES NOT PROVIDE TAP WATER!!! BE CAREFUL IF YOU ARE ORDERING SPICY FOOD!!!

They charge $1.50 for bottled water. They said they don't have tap water.... How is that possible? Seems like a health code violation to not have tap water.

The menu is pretty big, and compared to other Vietnamese restaurants in the area, the prices are on the higher end, but they accept credit cards!

We ordered the hotpot, which was really good. The broth was delicious, but all the ingredients were straight up frozen like they pulled them from a frozen package from the nearby supermarket. The mushrooms were obviously canned as well lol. The plating was also super pretty! It was good don't get me wrong, and I know the broth is what I came for, but it's too obvious!

Overall, amazing broth, but the overall experience was just okay.

There is a reason that Rice Paper is always ranked one of the best restaurants in northern Virginia. This place is amazing. The ambiance is cute and chic. The staff are so friendly. The real star is the food. Everything we got was so delicious. I'd go back a million times just to try the whole menu. This place is great.

Very busy on a Monday .. a good sign in my book. The BBQ pork bun was the stand out winner of our order. The meat was tender bursting with flavor complimented by a generous amount of beautifully cut vegetables in a well balanced sauce . The Pho Ga was average tasting ,not a fan of  the bones , skin, and gristle.  I will be back for the bun and rice plates . The service is good. You have to buy water , so what ?

Great variety of food, the flavor is pretty authentic. Always busy, we had to wait about 20 mins to get seated and 1 hour to pick up our to-go order. The service was great though, waiters were young, moved fast, friendly and sweet.

It was crowded around dinner time but we were lucky to be seated at the big table as we were a large group. The restaurant doesn't serve tap water, we have to buy their bottles of water or drinks. Foods were average but a little salty to my taste.
